Key Match Events: Davis Schneider hit a two-run triple
Bassitt struck out eight against his former team
Leo Jim√©nez reached base three times and drove in a run
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets lost for the second time in 12 games and fell into a tie with Atlanta for the final National League wild card
Others: Bassitt won for the first time since Aug. 6 against Baltimore
Left-hander Brendon Little got one out in the seventh and righty Zach Pop got the final two, striking out Pete Alonso to end the frame and strand a runner at third base
Mets left-hander David Peterson was charged with five runs, four earned, and a season-high tying eight hits in 4 1/3 innings
Nimmo's RBI single gave the Mets a 1-0 lead in a three-hit first but Toronto tied it in the second before adding four more in the third
Alejandro Kirk hit an RBI double
Spencer Horwitz answered in the bottom half with an RBI double
